Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

title: Hello World

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Post.title: Linux
Post._content:
## 
I2C
 **Linux** 

```bash
sudo apt-get install lm-sensors fancontrol -y #  lm-sensors fancontrol
```

 **lm-sensors**  **fancontrol** 

|  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
| lm-sensors | sensors |  |
| fancontrol | pwmconfig |  |


```bash
sudo pwmconfig
```
 `y`  

| sudo pwmconfig | sensors |
| --- | --- |
| ![1](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Caffreyfans/Public-Source/master/pictures/blog_2/1.jpg) | ![2](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Caffreyfans/Public-Source/master/pictures/blog_2/2.jpg) |

 `sudo pwmconfig` `Found the following PWM controls:` `hwmon3/pwm1`  `hwmon3/pwm1` 
```bash
echo 50 > /etc/class/hwmon/hwmon3/pwm1
```

 **PWM** **PWM**  0~255 0 255 /hwmon3/pwm1 **/sys/class/hwmon/hwmon3/pwm1** 

 **50**

Post.title: SPI Flash Modes
Post._content:
#  [https://github.com/espressif/esptool/wiki/SPI-Flash-Modes](https://github.com/espressif/esptool/wiki/SPI-Flash-Modes)

 ESP8266  ESP32  SPI  DIODOUTDIO  QOUT B[https://github.com/Caffreyfans/Caffreyfans.github.io.git](https://github.com/Caffreyfans/Caffreyfans.github.io.git) issues 

ESP8266  ESP32  4  SPI flash DIODOUTDIO  QOUT `esptool.py write_flash`  `--flash_mode` 

 I/O  SPI  SPI 

ESP8266  ESP32  SPI 

## 


||||(ESP8266 & ESP32)|
| ------ | -------- | -------- | -------- |
|qio| I/O| 4 ||
|qout|| 4 | `qio`  15%|
|dio| I/O| 2 | `qio`  45%|
|dout|| 2 | `qio`  50%|

 flash  FAQ 

##
###  SPI
SPI 4 
* CLK
* MOSI
* MISO)
* CS
[ SPI ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_Peripheral_Interface)

 SPI MISOMOSI

 SPI - 40MHz  = 40Mbits/ = 5Mbytes/

###  SPI
SPI  SPI SPI MOSI  MISO  2  SPI

 `dout` 3BH SPI  MOSI  MISO  2  MISO  SPI 

 `dio`  I/O BBH SPI  MOSI  MISO  2  2 

 ESP8266  ESP32 32  dio  dout  5%

 SPI 

###  SPI
 SPI SPI  SPI WP  HOLD  SPI 

 flash  SPI  ESP8266  ESP32  SPI 

 `qout` 6BH 4  2  4 

 `qio`  I/O EBH I/O  4  2  4  I/O 

## 
###  qio  qout 

* SPI  WP  HOLD  GPIO  quad 
* SPI  quad   esptool.py flash 
*  Quad SPI  Quad SPI  ESP8266  ESP32 SPI ESP32  ESP8266 SDK SPI 

###  qout  dout  qio  dio 
 SPI  I/O I/O

###  SPI  SPI 
ESP8266  ESP32  flash  RAM  SPI  SPI 

 SPI  SPI  I/O  80Mhz  I/O  40HMz SPI 

###  ESP8266  ESP32 
 .bin  SPI  ROM esptool.py  `-flash_mode`  flash 



 ESP32  ESP-IDF  qio/qout  dio/dout  IDF  ROM  SPI  SPI

Post.title: DockerSamba
Post._content:
### 
 **Docker** **Samba** 

**Docker**  **APP** **Docker** **Docker**  **pull** **Docker**  **Docker** **Docker**  **CPU**  **Docker**  **CPU** 	 **Docker**  **Samba** 

 **Samba**  **Linux**  **Unix**  **Windows**  **Windows**  **Linux** 

### 
```bash
sudo docker run -it --name samba --restart always \
	--net host -p 139:139 -p 455:455  -v /home:/shared \
	-d dperson/samba -s "share;/shared;yes;no;yes" -n
```
:

sudo ->  root 

docker -> docker 

run -> docker 

-i -> 

-t -> 

--name ->  samba  samba

--restart -> always 

--net -> host 

-p -> 139455  **Samba** 

-v ->  /home:/shared  /home   /shared 

-d -> 

dperson/samba  

 **Docker** 

-s ->  "share;/shared;yes;no;yes"  share shared 

*** dperson/samba  [dperson/samba](https://hub.docker.com/r/dperson/samba/)***

Post.title: UEFI
Post._content:
Adam Willianson  "UEFI boot:how does that actually work, then?"

 AdamW 

[Kamil Paral](http://kparal.wordpress.com/) 

**  UEFI 100%  UEFI **

 UEFI  95%  UEFI UEFI [mig59's blog](http://mjg59.dreamwidth.org/)  - [Rod Smith](http://www.rodsbooks.com/linux-uefi/), [Peter Jones](http://blog.uncooperative.org/)Chris Murphy  OS  UEFI 



## 
BIOS  UEFI BISO  IBM PC UEFI  IMB UEFI

 'UEFI BIOS' 'UEFI BIOS 'UEFI BIOS'. BIOS  PC  PC  IBM PC  BIOS  UEFI  [Coreboot](http://www.coreboot.org/)/

 UEFI  UEFI  UEFI  2.2  UEFI UEFI  UEFI UEFI
